Articles.Content:
Huh. Yeah, I see no reason why it wouldn't work. I'd assume there's a mod incompatibility. Unless you have the newest Kethane installed, it's something not yet known of. Unfortunately I have no idea what mod could be causing it and unless Tingle knows how to fix it, all you could really do is uninstall some of your mods (mostly the ones with plugins) and see if it fixes it.

Are the clouds on the ground or in the air?

Neither. They're only visible once you're above a certain altitude. Kerbin looks the same from the ground.

I was searching around in the assets and I found this:

Anyone have a guess on what it might be?

Ok, here is my try of doing the Sol system in the Kerbol system *WARNING: This textures are not good for landing at planets with water*

Note: I also gave Minmus a new texture, tell me if you like it

Download link: https://mega.co.nz/#!F5gzHYBS!EHkdtgADjnXGt5buRipUTDxjcOtzEBm-vGDjKnNHcuM

Zip download: https://mega.co.nz/#!RoAw3IbA!XvE9N0zCY1816LAh-jPFrz7KytpM7ZFycPn-ZvPHONI

Instructions: Put it in Textures folder

Pictures:

Sources: "Celestia Motherlode"

"Monsters and Manuals"

Hope you like it, and if people will like it I'll put moon texures as well.

Edited August 11, 2013 by eran100

Huh. Yeah, I see no reason why it wouldn't work. I'd assume there's a mod incompatibility. Unless you have the newest Kethane installed, it's something not yet known of. Unfortunately I have no idea what mod could be causing it and unless Tingle knows how to fix it, all you could really do is uninstall some of your mods (mostly the ones with plugins) and see if it fixes it.

Damn it, forgot to add it sorry, it's 6 AM here and I worked all night long... Here is the download link: https://mega.co.nz/#!dsImhQQB!KpWOGkE4ytPJmXGaFBpkrlRrnwoLEVj5mh-QyCLXbeE

Did you download the cloud mod thingy?

Apatheticjester's Dreamscape Skybox

mushroomman's Cloud Pack

If you mean the cloud pack yes I did - I have the following installed:

Universe Replacer v2.2

Apatheticjester's Dreamscape Skybox

mushroomman's Cloud Pack

Where did you put the cloud mod?

Where did you put the cloud mod?

I put the skybox and cloud pack archives into the Gamedata/universereplacer folder.

Just to prove I got the files in the right place, here is another pic

I put the skybox and cloud pack archives into the Gamedata/universereplacer folder.

Just to prove I got the files in the right place, here is another pic

Have you tried reinstalling?

Have you tried reinstalling?

I figured it out finally...

There is a file in g:\Simulations\KSP_win-no-mods\GameData\UniverseReplacer\Plugins\PluginData\UniverseReplacer\ called universereplacer.cfg - it seems I had to alter the aliases in that to match what was in the mods pack.

I figured it out finally...

There is a file in g:\Simulations\KSP_win-no-mods\GameData\UniverseReplacer\Plugins\PluginData\UniverseReplacer\ called universereplacer.cfg - it seems I had to alter the aliases in that to match what was in the mods pack.

Good, also can you please give me feedback about thee pack I made? It's in page 46. I would like to know how can I improve it.
Is bump-mapping supported?

Good, also can you please give me feedback about thee pack I made? It's in page 46. I would like to know how can I improve it.

The raw map files I used were Duna5_00.tex Eve2_00.tex and newoceanmoon00.tex and they were are in Sharedassets10 if that's what you are asking. As for Kerbin, I actually found the image online but I can't find it anymore. But Kerbin's textures are also there.

The raw map files I used were Duna5_00.tex Eve2_00.tex and newoceanmoon00.tex and they were are in Sharedassets10 if that's what you are asking. As for Kerbin, I actually found the image online but I can't find it anymore. But Kerbin's textures are also there.

well in the GameData\UniverseReplacer\Plugins\PluginData\ UniverseReplacer\universereplacer.cfg I had to do the following to get the kerban clouds to show up:

KerbinScaledSpace300 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin1

KerbinScaledSpace401 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin2

but I have no way of knowing what Laythe, Duna, eve and jool original files are called

Does that make more sense now??

well in the GameData\UniverseReplacer\Plugins\PluginData\ UniverseReplacer\universereplacer.cfg I had to do the following to get the kerban clouds to show up:

KerbinScaledSpace300 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin1

KerbinScaledSpace401 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin2

but I have no way of knowing what Laythe, Duna, eve and jool original files are called

Does that make more sense now??

No... not really

Mostly because I had to do nothing of the sort and judging by the number of cloudy screenshots and lack of people asking for help, I can assume most people didn't have to do anything either. It's all very strange.

Here's what my config has in it.

Aliases
{
	GalaxyTex_NegativeX = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_NegativeX
	GalaxyTex_NegativeY = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_NegativeY
	GalaxyTex_NegativeZ = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_NegativeZ
	GalaxyTex_PositiveX = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_PositiveX
	GalaxyTex_PositiveY = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_PositiveY
	GalaxyTex_PositiveZ = Textures/Skybox/Skybox_PositiveZ

	suncoronanew = Textures/Sun/Sun_Corona

	moho00 = Textures/Planets/Moho/Moho1
	moho01 = Textures/Planets/Moho/Moho2

	Eve2_00 = Textures/Planets/Eve/Eve1
	Eve2_01 = Textures/Planets/Eve/Eve2

	evemoon100 = Textures/Moons/Gilly/Gilly1
	evemoon101 = Textures/Moons/Gilly/Gilly2

	KerbinScaledSpace300 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin1
	KerbinScaledSpace401 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin2

	NewMunSurfaceMapDiffuse = Textures/Moons/Mun/Mun1
	NewMunSurfaceMapNormals = Textures/Moons/Mun/Mun2

	NewMunSurfaceMap00 = Textures/Moons/Minmus/Minmus1
	NewMunSurfaceMap01 = Textures/Moons/Minmus/Minmus2

	Duna5_00 = Textures/Planets/Duna/Duna1
	Duna5_01 = Textures/Planets/Duna/Duna2

	desertplanetmoon00 = Textures/Moons/Ike/Ike1
	desertplanetmoon01 = Textures/Moons/Ike/Ike2

	dwarfplanet100 = Textures/Planets/Dres/Dres1
	dwarfplanet101 = Textures/Planets/Dres/Dres2

	gas1_clouds = Textures/Planets/Jool/Jool1
	cloud_normal = Textures/Planets/Jool/Jool2

	newoceanmoon00 = Textures/Moons/Laythe/Laythe1
	newoceanmoon01 = Textures/Moons/Laythe/Laythe2

	gp1icemoon00 = Textures/Moons/Vall/Vall1
	gp1icemoon01 = Textures/Moons/Vall/Vall2

	rockymoon100 = Textures/Moons/Tylo/Tylo1
	rockymoon101 = Textures/Moons/Tylo/Tylo2

	gp1minormoon100 = Textures/Moons/Bop/Bop1
	gp1minormoon101 = Textures/Moons/Bop/Bop2

	gp1minormoon200 = Textures/Moons/Pol/Pol1
	gp1minormoon201 = Textures/Moons/Pol/Pol2

	snowydwarfplanet00 = Textures/Planets/Eeloo/Eeloo1
	snowydwarfplanet01 = Textures/Planets/Eeloo/Eeloo2
}

well in the GameData\UniverseReplacer\Plugins\PluginData\ UniverseReplacer\universereplacer.cfg I had to do the following to get the kerban clouds to show up:

KerbinScaledSpace300 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin1

KerbinScaledSpace401 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin2

but I have no way of knowing what Laythe, Duna, eve and jool original files are called

Does that make more sense now??

KerbinScaledSpace300 = Textures/Planets/Kerbin/Kerbin1
